content.description: This route climbs through bands of great limestone broken by bands of chossier stuff.  Lots of time went into cleaning the route, but I'm sure that there will be more monster scales to shed in the chossier bands, so make sure the belayer is wearing a hard hat.  The crux is encountered just before the seventh bolt as you pull onto a technical slab.  Overall fun climbing for what it is.
content.location: this route is the only route to the right of the big arch.  Just walk 20 feet right of the arch and look for bolts.

climbs.name: Bear Lake Monster
climbs.fa: Shaun Roundy and Antone Roundy June/July 1999

content.description:
The bottom half of the route is nothing special. Pro is fine, holds are fine.

The middle section has a nice crack but not much for feet. Above that is the best part with more crack, a few pockets, etc.

Rig your own belay from a few trees atop the cliff - bring webbing to extend the belay closer to the cliff top.

Walk off back toward the road and pass down through the huge cave.
content.location: From the top switchback on Swan Flats Road, hike along the cliff band, past the huge cave which provides great access to the top of the crag, until you see what is obviously the best line you've laid eyes on in this area.
